did.unittitle: Manuscripts
"Effie Mather A tale of New England" by Grace Greenwood

scopecontent.p: [Incomplete: pages numbered 1 -4 and 17 -20.]

did.unittitle: "Reminiscences of Washington Before & During the War" by Grace Greenwood
Poem beginning, "Says Juliet, in her balcony,..." signed Grace Greenwood
Poem beginning, "Sweet Juliet in her balcony..."
Poem, "To George Peabody" by [ Grace Greenwood]
Letters
Sara J[ane] Clarke[ Grace Greenwood], Warren, Ohio, to Sally Holley, Rochester, New York

scopecontent.p: [Letter of introduction for Mr. Wills of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, "a Liberty Abolitionist, and with the ardent devotion of a pilgrim..." who will "attend the convention for the erection of the monument to the memory of your lamented father --" [ Myron Holley(1779-1841)]. Praises Wills as a "champion of Freedom."]

did.unittitle: Grace Greenwood, Washington, to [Edwin Percy] Whipple(1819-1886)

scopecontent.p: [Letter of introduction for W[illiam] T[urner] Coggeshall(1824-1867) of Cincinnati, Ohio, also of the press.]

did.unittitle: Grace Greenwood, Blackhearth Park, to [George] Virtue(ca. 1793-1868)

scopecontent.p: [Thanks him for the offer to bring out one of her juvenile books. Regrets not being able to write a preface because of illness and going to Paris, France. Requests that his proposed alterations to the language be given to [Francis] Bennoch(1812-1890) for approval. Comments that Heads and Tails; Studies and Stories of Petswould be a better book to begin with rather than Recollections of My Childhood, and Other Stories. ]

did.unittitle: Grace Greenwood, Cleveland, Ohio, to [Anne Lynch] Botta(1815-1891)

scopecontent.p: [Letter of introduction for Virginia Wagner, a French-German lady, who wishes to establish herself in this country as a teacher.]

did.unittitle: Grace Greenwood, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, to C[ ] K[ ] Gallup

scopecontent.p: [Sends an autograph.]

did.unittitle: Grace Greenwood, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, to [ ] Porter

scopecontent.p: [Reminds him of their meeting years ago before asking for a favor; mentions Fanny Fern(1811-1872); comments on wanting to write for the New York Ledgerin addition to the Independentand certain magazines; mentions [Robert] Bonner(1824-1899) in reference to this matter; comments that she wants "to arrive at something like a certainty in regard to my literary work for the coming season --"]

did.unittitle: Grace [Greenwood], Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, to "My dear friend"

scopecontent.p: [Relates the importance of their constant friendship. Thanks the recipient for his book and comments on "Lines on a Tea Leaf," a portrait of herself, as being perhaps a little overdrawn. Tries to persuade the recipient to visit Washington, D. C.to regain strength and courage. Mentions her mother's visit and her attendance of the sessions of the "Colored Men's Convention and the Woman's Suffrage Convention," and going to hear Fred[erick] Douglas(1817-1895). Mentions her own "Yankee Sketches" in the Independent. ]

did.unittitle: Grace Greenwood, Washington, D. C., to "Dear Rebecca"

scopecontent.p: [Discusses her illness of the past few weeks. Sends one of [Charles] Dickens' (1812-1870) notes and comments that she has mislaid Jean Ingelow's (1820-1897) autograph.]

did.unittitle: Grace Greenwood, Washington, D. C., to "My dear child"

scopecontent.p: [Sends an autograph.]

did.unittitle: Grace Greenwood, New York, New York, to [Oliver] Johnson(1809-1889)

scopecontent.p: [Requests assistance in retrieving a copy of her sketch of [ Joseph Massini] from the New York Tribuneand send it to her in care of Mrs. Vincenzo [ Anne Lynch] Botta. ]

did.unittitle: Grace Greenwoodto [ Edward W.] Bok(1863-1930)

scopecontent.p: [Thanks him for the kind words and deeds, including the Jenny Lind(1820-1897) letter. Sends regards to [ Sarah Tittle Barrett] Bolton(1814-1893). Asks to borrow a copy of The Century. ]

did.unittitle: S[ara] J[ane] Lippincott[ Grace Greenwood], [on letterhead "Shawme Farm, Sandwich, Mass."], to Charles Elmer Rice, Mount Union, Stark County, Ohio

scopecontent.p: [Promises to find some autographs, including a Fanny Fernletter, upon her return to her New Yorkhome; mentions Margaret Bailey, Marcellus Reily, Lydia Maria Child(1802-1880), Lucy Stone Blackwell(1818-1893), Elizabeth [Palmer] Peabody(1804-1894), and William Lloyd Garrison(1805-1879).]

did.unittitle: Grace Greenwood, [New York, New York], to [William Hayes] Ward(1835-1916)

scopecontent.p: [Concerns literary matters, including publishing pieces from her Washington "Recollections."]

did.unittitle: Grace Greenwood, Washington, D. C., to [Henry Chandler] Bowen(1813-1896)

scopecontent.p: [Concerns her Washington "Reminiscences" and the method of its publication; mentions [William Hayes] Ward. ]

did.unittitle: Grace Greenwood, Washington, D. C., to "Dear old Chappie"

scopecontent.p: [Mentions the prose of Charles [Warren] Stoddard(1843-1899) and the death of the Marchese [Della Fonte Filippo] Biscaccianti. ]

did.unittitle: Grace Greenwood' ("Mrs. S. J. Lippincott"), Washington, D. C., to Gilson Willets(1869- )

scopecontent.p: [Regrets that she is unable to assist him with his article (on herself); mentions her homes in Washington, D. C.and New Brighton, Pennsylvaniaand her grandson Herbert Lippincott Winslowand her son-in-law Herbert Hall Winslow. ]

did.unittitle: Grace Greenwood, Washington, D. C., to Gilson Willets

scopecontent.p: [Concerns his article on Greenwood, offering assistance, some photographs and biographical sketches; mentions an oil painting by George P[eter Alexander] Healy(1813-1894).]

did.unittitle: S[ara] J[ane] Lippincott[ Grace Greenwood], Washington, D. C., to Gilson Willets

scopecontent.p: [Curt letter concerning his last letter which did not answer her questions; mentions being involved in duties connected with the illness, death and burial of a dear friend]

did.unittitle: Sara J[ane] Lippincott[ Grace Greenwood], Washington, D. C., to Gilson Willets

scopecontent.p: [Explains what she has done and proposes to do to further his wishes and what her wishes were concerning the article; mentions the photographs and biographical sketches.]

did.unittitle: Grace Greenwood, New Rochelle, New York, to "My dear friend"

scopecontent.p: [Wishes to hear from her friend, mentioning the recipient's recent trip to England; mentions worries over domestic and business affairs; refers to [Henry] Holt(1840-1926) of the Independentand her last batch of "Reminiscences" being mislaid; mentions a letter of hers printed in 1859 located by [William Hayes] Ward. ]

did.unittitle: Grace Greenwood, New Rochelle, New York, to [Henry] Holt

scopecontent.p: [Requests the next to the last manuscript of the reminiscent article be returned.]

did.unittitle: Grace Greenwoodto [ ] Tyler

scopecontent.p: [Concerns letters she has prepared for him.]

did.unittitle: Sara J[ane] Lippincott[ Grace Greenwood] to [Rufus Wilmot] Griswold(1815-1857)

scopecontent.p: [Concerns the poems she is sending to him; asks if he wants any biographical notes; requests correspondence to be sent in care of L[ouis] A[ntoine] Godey(1804-1878).]
